Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge erred in rejecting the application due to non-compliance with residency requirements under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Mr. El Falah reported conflicting absence periods (391 vs. 351 days); insufficient proof of Canadian residence during claimed periods
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Citizenship Judge's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged error by Citizenship Judge in assessing residency compliance
Credibility_Assessment: Judge doubted physical presence due to inconsistent evidence
Evidence_Used: Supporting documentation (or lack thereof) for residence in Canada
Application_Basis: Requirement of 1095 days of physical presence in Canada over four years
Governing_Rule: Applicants must prove 1095 days of physical presence in Canada
Cause_Description: Discrepancies in reported absences and lack of supporting documents led to rejection
Evidence_Handling: Judge assessed credibility and sufficiency of evidence regarding residency
Misrepresentation_Element: Potential misrepresentation due to conflicting absence reports
Decision_Rationale: Judge acted reasonably based on lack of convincing evidence of required residency
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to provide proof of residence
